Fabric.description:
Object Types are:
  * pods
  * policies
  * recommended_settings

policies.description:
Object Types are:
  * global
  * interface
  * monitoring
  * pod

recommended_settings.description:
Object Types are:
  * fabric_node_controls
  * l3_interface
  * pods
  These Default Setting Values can be seen in defaults/fabric.yaml.

Fabric.title: fabric - Fabric => Fabric Policies

policy_group.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * bgp_route_reflector_policy
  * coop_group_policy
  * date_time_policy
  * description
  * isis_policy
  * macsec_policy
  * management_access_policy
  * snmp_policy

profile.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * description
  * policy_group
  * pod_selector_type
  * pods

management_access_policy.description: Name of the Management Access Policy.
management_access_policy.title: management_access_policy

name.description: Name of the Pod Policy Group.

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

policy_group.description: Name of the Pod Policy Group to add to the Selector Group.
policy_group.title: policy_group

pod_selector_type.description:
Options are:
  * ALL (default): Select all Pods in the Fabric.
  * range: Select Specific Pods in the Fabric.
pod_selector_type.title: pod_selector_type

pods.description:
if pod_selector_type is set to range, enter the starting and ending pods to add to the selector group.
Format. [{staring_pod_id}, {ending_pod_id}]
pods.title: pods

Fabric:Pods:Profile.title: profile - Fabric => Fabric Policies => Pod => Profile.

dns_profiles.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * dns_domains
  * dns_providers
  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * description
  * ip_version_preference
  * management_epg
dns_profiles.title: dns_profiles - Policies => Global => dns_profiles

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

dns_domains.description: The DNS domain uses a hierarchical scheme for establishing host names for network nodes and allows local control of the segments of the network through a client-server scheme. The DNS system can locate a network device by translating the hostname of the device into its associated IP address.

items.description: Name of a L3 Domain Policy

default_domain.description: Indicates whether this domain is the default domain. Only one domain in the group can be the default. Default is false.
default_domain.title: default_domain

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

items.title: dns_domains - DNS Domains

dns_providers.description: The DNS provider is a DNS server that uses a hierarchical scheme for establishing host names for network nodes, which local control of the segments of the network through a client-server scheme. The DNS system can locate a network device by translating the hostname of the device into its associated IP address.

items.description:
Required Attributes:
  * dns_provider

Optional Attributes:
  * description
  * preferred

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

dns_provider.description: The IPv4 or IPv6 address of the DNS provider.
dns_provider.title: dns_provider

preferred.description: pecifies if this the preferred provider. Only one provider in the group should be preferred.  Default is false.
preferred.title: preferred

items.title: dns_providers - DNS Providers

ip_version_preference.description: The preferred IP protocol to perform DNS Lookups with.
ip_version_preference.title: ip_version_preference

management_epg.description: The Name of the management EPG.
management_epg.title: management_epg

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

bfd_isis_policy_configuration.description:
State ( enabled or disabled) of the BFD-IS-IS policy configuration.
  * enabled: (default)
  * disabled
bfd_isis_policy_configuration.title: bfd_isis_policy_configuration

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

fabric_node_controls.description:
Attributes are:
  * annotation
  * description
  * enable_dom
  * feature_selections

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

enable_dom.description:
A check box that enables or disables digital optical monitoring (DOM) for the fabric node control.
  * true: (default) — Enables digital optical monitoring.
  * false — Disables digital optical monitoring.
enable_dom.title: enable_dom

feature_selections.description:
ACI switch hardware supports either NetFlow or Cisco Tetration Analytics, but not both. If the APIC pushes both Cisco Tetration Analytics and NetFlow configurations to a particular node, the chosen priority flag alerts the switch as to which feature should be given priority. The other feature’s configuration is ignored.
  * analytics — Analytic priority downloads the Cisco Tetration Analytics sensor software for installation on the switches.
  * netflow — Netflow priority downloads and installs the Cisco Netflow configuration on the switches to analyze network traffic.
  * telemetry: (default) — Telemetry priority is used in conjunction with the Network Insight Resources APIC App. This policy enables Cisco Telemetry configuration on the switches to analyze network traffic.
feature_selections.title: feature_selections

Fabric:Policies:Monitoring:FabricNodeCon.title: fabric_node_controls - Policies => Monitoring => Fabric Node Controls.

  * name

Optional Attributes are:
  * annotation

  * authentication_keys
  * description
  * display_format

date_and_time.title: date_and_time - Policies => Pod => Date and Time.

Required Attributes are:
  * name
  * snmp_client_groups

Optional Attributes are:

  * include_types
  * location

snmp.title: snmp - Policies => Pod => snmp.

administrative_state.description:
The NTP protocol can be enabled or disabled. If enabled, the system uses the NTP protocol. The NTP protocol can be either of the following:
  * enabled: (default) — NTP protocol is enabled.
  * disabled — NTP protocol is disabled.
administrative_state.title: administrative_state

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

authentication_keys.description:
List of NTP Authentication keys; when performing NTP Authentication.  Required Attributes are:
key_id

Optional Attributes are:
  * authentication_type: (default)
  * external_epg

items.description:
authentication_keys - Required Attributes are:
  * key_id

Optional Attributes are:
  * authentication_type
  * trusted

authentication_type.description:
authentication_type: (optional) — The authentication key type can be:
  * md5 — Use HMAC MD5 algorithm for authentication
  * sha1: (default) — Use HMAC SHA1 algorithm for authentication
authentication_type.title: authentication_type

key_id.description: The user-configured NTP client authentication key identifier. The NTP client authentication key is for authenticating time synchronization.  This is a reference to the Sensitive Variable ntp_key_{1-5}, which should be loaded into the environment as TF_VAR_ntp_key_{1-5}.
key_id.title: key_id

trusted.description:
The trust status of the authentication key. This indicates if the NTP authentication key is trusted. The trust states of the NTP authentication key follows:
  * false — The authentication key is not trusted.
  * true: (default) — The authentication key is trusted.
trusted.title: trusted

authentication_keys.title: authentication_keys

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

display_format.description:
The date/time display format selector. The display format can be UTC or local. The date/time display format can be either of the following:
  * local: (default) — Date/time is displayed in local time.
  * utc — Date/time is displayed in UTC.
display_format.title: display_format

management_epg.description: Name of the Management EPG.  Default is 'default'
management_epg.title: management_epg

master_mode.description:
Enables the designated NTP server to provide undisciplined local clock time to downstream clients with a configured stratum number. For example, a leaf switch that is acting as the NTP server can provide undisciplined local clock time to leaf switches acting as clients.  The options are:
  * enabled — The designated NTP server provides undisciplined local clock time.
  * disabled: (default) — The designated NTP server does not provide undisciplined local clock time.
Notes:
  * Master Mode is only applicable when the server clock is undisciplined.
  * The default master mode stratum number is 8.
master_mode.title: master_modemaster_mode

maximum_polling_interval.description: The maximum NTP default polling value in seconds.  The maximum interval range is from 4 to 16. This default is 6.
maximum_polling_interval.title: maximum_polling_interval

minimum_polling_interval.description: The minimum NTP default polling value in seconds.  The minimum interval range is from 4 to 16. This default is 5.
minimum_polling_interval.title: minimum_polling_interval

name.description: Name for the Date and Time Pod Policy.
name.title: name

ntp_servers.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * ntp_server

Optional Attributes are:
  * description
  * key_id
  * preferred

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: administrative_state

key_id.description: Reference to the NTP Authentintication Key if using authentication.
key_id.title: key_id

ntp_server.description: Hostname/IP Address of the NTP Server
ntp_server.title: ntp_server

preferred.description: Indicates if the NTP server is preferred. Multiple preferred servers can be configured. The NTP server preference by default is false.
preferred.title: preferred

ntp_servers.title: ntp_servers

offset_state.description:
The display of the offset can be enabled or disabled. This enables you to view the difference between the local time and the reference time. 
  * enabled: (default)
  * disabled
offset_state.title: offset_state

server_state.description:
Enables switches to act as NTP servers to provide NTP time information to downstream clients. The options are:
  * enabled — Switch, while being acting as a client, serves the time as server to other clients.
  * disabled: (default) — Switch acts as a client to an NTP server
Notes: To support the server functionality, it is always recommended to have a peer setup for the server. This enables the server to provide a consistent time to the clients.
  * Do not configure the node in the same fabric as the peer of the server.
  * The NTP server sends time info with a stratum number, an increment to the system peer's stratum number, to switches that are synched to the upstream server.
  * The server sends time info with stratum 16 if the switch clock is not synched to the upstream server. Clients are not able to sync to this server.
server_state.title: server_state - Server State

stratum_value.description: Specifies the stratum level from which NTP clients get their time synchronized. The range is from 1 to 15.  The default master mode stratum number is 8.
stratum_value.title: stratum_value - Stratum

admin_state.description:
The administrative state of the SNMP policy. The state can be:
  * disabled
  * enabled: (default)
admin_state.title: admin_state

annotation.description: An annotation will mark an Object in the GUI with a small blue circle, signifying that it has been modified by  an external source/tool.  Like Nexus Dashboard Orchestrator or in this instance Terraform.
annotation.title: annotation

contact.description: The contact information for the SNMP policy.
contact.title: contact

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

include_types.description:
Attributes are:
  * audit_logs
  * events
  * faults
  * session_logs
The Type of messages to include in the SNMP Policy.

audit_logs.description: Include Audit Logs.  Default is false.
audit_logs.title: audit_logs

session_logs.description: Include Session Logs.  Default is false.
session_logs.title: session_logs

include_types.title: include_types

location.description: The location for the SNMP policy.
location.title: location

snmp_client_groups.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * clients

Optional Attributes are:
  * description
  * management_epg
  * name

clients.description:
List of Client Groups to assign to the SNMP Policy.
clients - Required Attributes are:
  * address

Optional Attributes are:
  * name
If Name is undefined Address will be assigned as the name.

address.description: The SNMP client profile IPv4/IPv6 address or Hostname.
address.title: address

name.description: The name of the client group profile. This name can be between 1 and 64 alphanumeric characters.
name.title: name

clients.title: clients - SNMP => Client Group => Clients

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

name.description: Name for the SNMP Cllient Group.
name.title: name

snmp_client_groups.title: snmp_client_groups - SNMP Client Groups

Required Attributes are:
  * key_id

Optional Attributes are:
  * authentication_type
  * trusted

community_variable.description: A value between 1 to 5 that will point to the snmp_community_{value} variable, which should be loaded into the environment as TF_VAR_snmp_community_{1-5}.
community_variable.title: community_variable

description.description: Description to add to the Object.  The description can be up to 128 characters.
description.title: description

snmp_communities.title: snmp_communities - SNMP Communities

snmp_destinations.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * host

Optional Attributes are:
  * authentication_type
  * trusted

community_variable.description: A value between 1 to 5 that will point to the snmp_community_{value} variable, which should be loaded into the environment as TF_VAR_snmp_community_{1-5}.
community_variable.title: community_variable

host.description: The host for the SNMP trap destination. SNMP traps enable an agent to notify the management station of significant events by way of an unsolicited SNMP message.
host.title: host

port.description: The service port of the SNMP trap destination. SNMP traps enable an agent to notify the management station of significant events by way of an unsolicited SNMP message. The range is from 0(unspecified) to 65535.  Default is 162.
port.title: port

username.description: The name of the SNMP User.
username.title: username

v3_security_level.description:
The SNMP V3 security level for the destination path. The level can be:
  * auth: (default)
  * noauth
  * priv
v3_security_level.title: v3_security_level

version.description:
The SNMP version to utilize for the Trap destination.
  * v1
  * v2c: (default)
  * v3
version.title: version

snmp_destinations.title: snmp_destinations - SNMP Destinations.

users.description:
Required Attributes are:
  * authorization_key
  * username

Optional Attributes are:
  * authorization_type
  * privacy_key
  * privacy_type

authorization_key.description: A value between 1 to 5 that will point to the snmp_authorization_key_{value} variable, which should be loaded into the environment as TF_VAR_snmp_authorization_key_{1-5}.
authorization_key.title: authorization_key

authorization_type.description:
The authentication type for the user profile. The authentication type is a message authentication code (MAC) that is used between two parties sharing a secret key to validate information transmitted between them. HMAC (Hash MAC) is based on cryptographic hash functions. It can be used in combination with any iterated cryptographic hash function. HMAC MD5 and HMAC SHA1 are two constructs of the HMAC using the MD5 hash function and the SHA1 hash function. HMAC also uses a secret key for calculation and verification of the message authentication values. Supported types are:
  * hmac-md5-96
  * hmac-sha1-96: (default)
  * hmac-sha2-224
  * hmac-sha2-256
  * hmac-sha2-384
  * hmac-sha2-512
authorization_type.title: authorization_type

privacy_key.description: A value between 1 to 5 that will point to the snmp_privacy_key_{value} variable, which should be loaded into the environment as TF_VAR_snmp_privacy_key_{1-5}.
privacy_key.title: privacy_key

privacy_type.description:
The privacy (encryption) type for the user profile. The type can be Data Encryption Standard (DES) or Advanced Encryption Standard (AES). Data Encryption Standard is a method of data encryption that uses a private (secret) key. DES applies a 56-bit key to each 64-bit block of data. Advanced Encryption Standard that uses a key with a length of 128 bits to encrypt data blocks with a length of 128 bits. The privacy types are:
  * aes-128
  * des
  * none: (default)
privacy_type.title: privacy_type

username.description: The name of the SNMP User to create.
username.title: username

users.title: users - SNMP Users

fabric_node_controls.description: Flag to configure recommended settings for the Error Disabled Recovery Policy.  These Default Setting Values can be seen in defaults/fabric.yaml.
fabric_node_controls.title: fabric_node_controls

l3_interface.description: Flag to configure recommended settings for the MCP Instance Policy.  These Default Setting Values can be seen in defaults/fabric.yaml.
l3_interface.title: l3_interface

pods.description: Flag to configure recommended settings for the QOS Class - dot1p preserve attribute.  These Default Setting Values can be seen in defaults/fabric.yaml.
pods.title: pods
